TopicTitle: Please Help me defeat the kraken

Articles.Content:
I build a 1000 ton+ launcher but it keeps shaking itsself apart at random moments during the ascent. Especially in the upper atmosphere around 50km I rely heavily on autostruts and it's quite solid until it gets the death shakes..

 

Is there anything i can try?
What are autostruts set to? A common problem seems to be setting them to Heaviest but as weight changes the autostruts try to adapt to the new Heaviest...and Kraken can happen.

Indeed, as @Jake_IV said, your reliance on autostruts is the likely problem.  It is better to set them to the grandparent part rather than the heaviest part.

Alternatively, you can try real struts instead of autostruts, or you can try to reach orbit with fewer struts--though of course that probably requires a redesign.

Doubly alternatively, if you also make use of fuel ducts for asparagus staging, the ducts reinforce in a strut-like fashion.  I don't know whether they are quite as strong as struts, but they are better than nothing.

@Jake_IV

@Zhetaan

Thanks for the feedback!

 

Some are set to heaviest part, some are set to grandparent part and some are set to root.

 

There is however a little part clipping between some of the fuel tanks. Not much but still..

Edited April 12, 2019 by Flying dutchman
